reviews.review_msg: Amyn himself is great. Approachable, easy-going, and fair. This course...well, SFU should reconsider it as a mandatory one. LOTS of assignments and heavy on the attendance component. Group projects also make up a good chunk of your grade so pray you get a group who cares.

I had a really fun time learning in Bus 240 thanks to Mr. Somani. His lectures were always engaging and he was always helpful when answering questions or concerns. Overall the course was good and it was a pleasure to learn from him.

Whole class is negotiating with TAs to get a better grade. Because your grade can always increase a few percent by bargaining with the TAs. Why not just give me those percentages the first time marked? Idiocracy at its finest.

Amyn himself is a good guy, good prof. 240 is just a bad course, but it's new, so it may be improved over time. The lectures were hit & miss, but could be fun sometimes. Pray you get a good group (40% of grade). There were also big differences in how both TA's marked assignments, which caused drama. Most assignments were also pretty confusing.

Amyn was a decent prof however it was hard to stay focused in class at times. There are no exams just two individual and two team assignments but they were a bit time-consuming. My only concern was the curve is really high which can make it hard to do well and you would often need to go to the Ta for a regrade.

He loves to talk about how great he is for most of the class. Group projects make up most of the grade so pray for a good group. If you dont come to class he will deduct marks for the next assignment. Class can be fun at times, but is pretty useless.
